opposite_reasoning: AtmosphericRegion_Field represents gaseous, fluid regions of planetary atmospheres. The strongest physical complement is solid terrestrial/land regions. This captures the fundamental geophysical opposition between Earth's major physical systems: atmosphere (gas) vs. lithosphere (solid). This opposition provides maximum semantic distance while remaining within the domain of planetary geography, making it ideal for Fisher-LDA centroid anchoring. The opposition is stronger than water (which shares fluidity with atmosphere) and more grounded than abstract concepts like vacuum.
